supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in modern pencil, i-iii, 1–263; there is a foliation, apparently by the original scribe, in red roman numerals, and a post-medieval foliation in ink in tiny arabic numbers, often partially or wholly cropped in binding.

layoutDesc.layout: 27 written lines per page, below top line; in 1 column.

handDesc.handNote: Fine 'fere humanistica' script, attributed to Michael de Salvaticis (see under Provenance).

decoDesc.decoNote: One reactangular miniature: the Stigmatization of St. Francis, his companion nearby outside a chapel, set in a lanscape with mountains, trees, bushes, a river, and animals; with a three-sided foliate border, including the Redeemer in a small roundel in the upper border, and the Virgin and Child seated on the ground in a larger roundel in the lower border (fol. 1r). (Pächt and Alexander ii. 464, pl. XLVI)

binding.p: Straight-grained dark blue morocco, the upper cover stamped in gilt with the Coke crest; the spine lettered in gilt 'BIBRACHI | ITINERUM | ÆTERNITATI | ET | ALIORUM | OPERA | – | MS. | SÆC. XV. | 154'.

history.provenance: The scribe is identifiable with Michael de Salvaticis , active in Venice c.1430–60.
Bernardo Trevisan , Venice, early 18th century ((Hassall, 1970), 24 n. 11).
Bookplate ' THOMAS WILLIAM COKE ' (1754–1842), and the signature 'Thos Wlm Coke' (fol. i verso); formerly Holkham Hall, MS. 154.
